Shaking his head to wonder about stupid pigs later he sat down to ponder on what he should do next. He could go back home, he was after all right in front of the Tendo house hold, but then again Akane was very angry at him and he definitely didn’t want to face Akane at this size or he could go to see Ukyo she could help him with out the fear of being crushed
125222211.title: Miny Ranma

1252222112.content:
Ranma needs to get help fast, Really fast before things get worse. So he better head towards the Tendo Dojo, which was only a few feet away. Scampering towards the house he noticed that some one had left the door open, probably by him as he was rushing out of the house earlier. As he ran into the house he notice how everything looked so different when you’re small. The tables and other furniture looked like skyscrapers and the walls seemed to almost reach to clouds.

At the same time as he wondered what he was going to do if one of his rivals found him, he would be as good as dead if he tried to fight them at his current size. With a groan he continued on through the giant house till he came to the stairs. If he headed up the flight of steps he would be less likely to run into his rivals on the second floor of the house but if he continued on the first floor it would be sure bet he could find someone hopefully not a rival to help him.
1252222112.title: Need Help

12522221122.content:
It would be better if I stayed downstairs, thought Ranma. That way I can find someone quickly even though I could run into someone who would crush me, I’ll just have to take the chance. With that in mind Ranma resumed his journey through the giant house till he reached the kitchen, when he heard the unmistakable sound of Kasumi humming in the Kitchen. With exhilaration he ran into the Kitchen to find Kasumi merrily preparing supper for the family. Surly Kasumi will help me unlike the other Tendo sisters, Nibiki would use his position to make a profit and Akane would simply squash me, Ranma contemplated.
“Hey Kasumi A little help here.” Screamed the shrunken Ranma. Who unhappily discovered that she hadn’t heard him. Considering how small he was ranma decided to jump up to the counter to get her undivided attention on the matter at hand. With an almost superhuman jump Ranma landed on the counter, but before he could shout out to Kasumi he was interrupted

Your names ((Insert name here)) and You are a student at Orange Star High School. After for what seemed like an eternity, the bell finally rings.

"Finally I thought this day would never end!" You say as you make your way out of class and down the hallway of your school with the rest of the students. Everything seems to be going as it should, when Then out of nowhere, a short black haired girl coming down the hall bumps right into you!

"Hey watch where you are walking shorty!" You say to her.

"Me?! You were the one who wasnt looking! And who are you calling shorty?!" She says back to you.

"Hey wait...Arent you Pan? Mr. Satans granddaughter?" You ask.

"Thats right!" Pan anwsers back.

"I see, no wonder you are so clumsy then. Must be taking after that big bald fat loser huh?" You said.

"Hey! Hes not fat! And he can kick your butt anyday too! I outta smash your face in for saying that!" Pan said.

"Oh yeah? Go for it midget! Show me what you got!" You say and give her a slight shove. Clenching her fists together, Pan knew that she was more than capable of punching your head clean off its shoulders, but she didnt want to show her powers off in her own school! Instead she had another idea of getting even with you.

"Yeah thats what I thought. All talk just like your idiot grandpa. Now if you excuse me ive got more important things to do than stand here and talk with you, See you later shorty." You said then walk out the school doors.

"Yes....I'll see you later soon too.." Pan said to herself with an evil grin on her face!



Later that night you sit in your backyard, still thinking about your experience with Pan earlier.

"Heh, I really showed that stupid girl today." You said then pull out a bottle of liquor. You take a huge swig of it and kick back in the chair.

"Arent you a little too young to be drinking?" You hear a familiar voice. Sitting up slowly you see Pan standing right in front of you.

"Hey shorty what are you-" Before you can finish Pan's fist slams right into your face causing you to instantly black out....



When you awaken, you are...

"What am I doing here? Am I dreaming all this or something?" You look around while scratching your head. Its pretty quiet. In fact, there are no cars driving in the street and not one single person other than yourself out here! Its like some twilight zone episode or something!

"So, You're awake now huh?" A very loud voice is heard above you! Slowly looking up you see Pan's Massive face stairing down on you like some kind of goddess!

"Do you like it? Its an exact replica of the city I made myself years ago as a school project. Now im using it as an ant farm to house little puny worthless bugs like you!" Pan said.

It then hits you that you have been Shrunk and placed in this tiny model city in her room! Sweat pours down your face as you realize what is all happening now!

"Now, im going to have a little fun with you, Shorty." Pan said cracking her knuckles with a huge evil grin on her face.

1252222222221.content:
You run through the trees jumping from branch to branch, clutching the gaping wound in your side. You throw a backwards glance but you can't see your pursuer through the dense forest. As you look forward once again light breaches the tree canopy illuminating a barely visible wire in your path. You see through the trap and jump aside. You grip the underside of a branch, the wire untouched. As you breathe a sigh of relief the whistling noise of a Hand Sword closes in on you. You release your grip on the tree just in time to avoid being decapitated but the blades carve through your left shoulder. You fall through the trees and desperately grab at a branch. You catch something in your hand as you fall, the trap wire. The wire breaks and you hold on tight to one end of the wire. You know now the trap has been set off there is no escaping it. Your hearing is filled with the sound of kunai and shuriken coming in from all directions. The razor sharp blades lodge into your body, and you feel your strength and chakra flowing out of you with your blood. Finally your opponent shows himself closing in to finish you off. Still holding the wire in your hand, you whip the end and it forms a noose around the enemy ninja’s neck. The wire slices into his neck and his head and body crash to the forest floor. You let go of the wire and fall to the ground. In the darkness you see more ninjas approaching and your vision fades as you pass into unconsciousness.

Even in your weakened mental state you capture flashes of the events around you. The ninja’s (which must’ve been allies) loosely bandage your wounds and return you to Konoha village. Various faces flash back and forth, which you presume to be medical ninja’s but the most common was a young woman with long blonde hair and a purple diamond-shaped forehead mark.

You awake in a daze laying on a hard surface. The wooden bench on which you lie must be an operation table. You try to move your arms but your muscles feel strained and tired. Most of your limbs and torso are heavily laden with bandages, which impede your movements further. With a lot of effort you manage to sit up but your eyes haven’t yet adjusted to the darkness. You move to swing your legs over the edge of the bench but you can’t seem to reach it.

You ponder over what happened while you slept but your thoughts are cut off by the door opening. The abnormally loud noise filled the room and violent tremors followed coming from the doorway. In the darkness you can vaguely see a large figure approaching. The tremors become increasingly louder and the figure becomes larger and taller with every step. The movements and sounds cease and there is a brief moment of silence. All at once the room is bathed in light as the light above the operating table is switched on. As you had guessed you were seated on an operating table, only it was gigantic! It stretches out hundreds of feet in either direction. The very distant light shows that it isn’t only the bench that is huge; the entire room is of similar proportions. It seems impossible, but somehow in the healing process you must’ve been shrunk. The figure who entered the room is no where to be seen.

It’s difficult to survey the area from your current position so you struggle to your feet and move to the edge of the bench. As you near the edge, the figure appears from under the bench. You fall back in surprise and look in awe at the huge person now fully upright before you. It’s the blonde medical ninja from earlier who you now recognise as Tsunade, one of the Konoha Sennin. She giggles as you stumble backwards in shock.
“Didn’t mean to startle you” she said.
She was a very good looking young woman. She wore a light brown sleeveless uniform top, which struggled to hold the weight of her humungous bust, navy blue pants and a long green jacket.
“What’s happened to me?” you ask.
Her expression becomes more serious and she seats herself on the bench next to you.
“It’s what was needed to keep you alive.”
“Why? And how did this happen?” you say, still confused.
“You’re currently the top Jounin in Konoha. You’re set to become ANBU as soon as the agency clears your record. With the various nations on the brink of war we couldn’t afford to loose a shinobi of your stature.” She pauses briefly. “The wounds you sustained on your last mission were very serious and we feared for your life. As I last desperate act I modified my personal regeneration jutsu to withdraw my own chakra, merge it with your injured cells and by manipulating the chakra I was able to compress and seal your wounds.”
You’re still a little confused as to how you became shrunk. “So what’s this got to do with me being shrunk?”
She pauses a second time.
“Because the procedure was rushed I overlooked several details. The seals required to move chakra from a human body to another caused major stress to my own body, so I could on move a fraction of my own chakra to regenerate you.”
You start to see how this happened. “So since there wasn’t enough chakra for my body, my body had to become smaller until there was enough chakra to heal me.”
Tsunade nods, “That’s correct.”
“But as soon as my body begins to make chakra again I can slowly be restored to size right?”
“If all goes well then that will be the case, but your central chakra system was the most damaged of all. There is a chance it will not recover.”
You are shocked to hear this news. “So I could be like this my entire life.”
Tsunade hung her head. “Yes, but there’s one other fact which you may be interested to know; since my own chakra controls your body’s cells and overall structure, I can control your physical form to a certain extent.”
“Meaning what?” you say, a little confused now.
“Ok, you’re currently 4 inches tall. Since I can manipulate your body, I can make you any size between 4 inches and microscopic.”
“Ok I think I understand now.” You say, after thinking for a minute.

Tsunade climbs off the bench. “You’ll stay with me and I’ll monitor your medical condition. Your body should be healed by now, you can remove the bandages.”
You nod and start removing the bandages. You stretch a little and you feel strength returning to you. Her giant palm scoops you up and carries you out of the hospital. She slips you in her pants pocket so as not to draw attention in the streets of Konoha. You sit quietly in her pocket for some time, before you become curious as to where you are headed. You hit her leg trying to get her attention, and after some time she pulls you out. She pretends to be scratching her shoulder (still being in the street) and cups you against her neck.
“What is it?” she whispers.
“Where are we going?” you ask.
“We’re going to…
1252222222221.title: You life is in her hands

Sakura sat in her desk, daydreaming again. This time thinking about lunch. It was the beginning of the day, first period wasn't even over yet, and Sakura was already thinking about lunch... always thinking with her stomach. However, her daydreams of pizza and soda was cut shor by a hollaring teacher.

"Sakura!!" shouted an angry and raspy sounding woman's vocie.

"What?!" Sakura jumped up with fright and surprise, her heartrate accelerating by at least 10 times.

"Stop being creative and memorize information like a zombie!!" barked the teacher, heading back to her desk. "Anyway, class... we have another new student today. This new hopeless addition to the student body is from America. Please welcome, Mike Corum."

Into the classroom stepped a kid with really bad, uncombed and unstyled, short blonde hair. He was pretty pale, which was normal in Japan. He was relatively handsome. Not very muscular, a tad on the scrawny side, but still capable of delivering a good punch it seemed.

He was wearing a Red Hot Chili Peppers T-shirt with some blue jeans. His sneakers were different brands and one was untied. To top it all off, he didn't really step into the classroom. More like... he rolled in on a skateboard.

"Mr. Corum, no skateboards on campus. I'll have to take that." hissed the teacher, taking the skateboard from under Mike's feet. "Now then, Mike will need a study partner to help him catch up with current work. Any volunteers?"

Immediately all the girls, minus Mei-Lin, raised their hands and, wouldn't you know it, out of all the girls in the class, Sakura got picked.

*********
LATER
*********

"Sooo... how do you pronounce your last name again?" Mike asked, sitting on Sakura's bed.

"Kinomoto." she said with a smile at Mike's difficulty pronouncing it.

"Kimono? Like... the robe?"

"No, Key-no-moe-toe." Sakura said slowly, trying her best not to laugh.

"Ok, got it. Soooo... what've I-"

"Sakura, could you come down here for a second?" shouted Touya, interrupting Mike.

"Coming!"

So, Sakura left and Mike began looking through the room. He saw a strange looking book sitting on a table. When he opened it, cards fell on the table. One, however, fell on the floor. Mike picked it up and looked at it.

"The little?" he asked.

As soon as he said it's name, a flash of light enveloped him. The next thing Mike knew, he was just a hair under 5 inches tall. He looked around the room, wondering what the hell just happened. Then, the door opened and all his fears were realized... he had been shrunk, and if he didn't get Sakura to notice him, he was in deep shit.

131.content:
Tifa sat alone at a table in a near-deserted restaurant bordering on a lush garden maze, impatiently awaiting the arival of Cloud, who had agreed to take her out that evening. She was wearing her black leather sleeveless jacket (as seen in Advent Children) over a white singlet top containing her ample charms, and her modest black shorts and belt fitting snuggly around her athletic body.

In a inn room somewhere nearby, Cloud was doing a quick mirror check to make sure he looked plausibly well dressed for his date with Tifa. He was already rather late, having spent the day with Aeris, and though didn't want to leave the inn without her, he had made a promise with Tifa that he would see her and that Aeris wouldn't get in her way. Cloud sighed heavily and moved towards the door, but he was stopped by Aeris waiting by the door. She went to him as he approached and threw her arms up around his neck.

"Aww, Cloud... why do you have to head out now?" Aeris pouted, "I know you're going to see 'her', but you said you would stay with me."

Cloud moved her arms off his neck.

"Look Aeris, I'm just going out to catch up with her. It's not like we're an item or anything, and I promised her I would." Cloud responded.

"Well at least let me come along!" Aeris persisted, "I know you say you're just friends, but she comes accross as far too suggestive for my tastes."

Cloud sighed again, "We've been over this, you know I promised that I wouldn't bring you along."

"I could hide somewhere!"

"You'll be seen!"

"Please!!!"

Cloud dropped his head, realising that persisting in the conversation was only making him later, and Tifa more aggitated.

"Look I'm off, I'll see you when I get back."

Aeris grabbed his hand before he could make it out the door, "Wait! I have one last idea. It'll let me come along undetected."

Cloud rolled his eyes, "Aeris..."

"Just close your eyes, and you'll see how well I can hide myself." Aeris mused, a slight grin in the corner of the mouth.

"Ok", said a defeated Cloud, "But make it quick"

With only confidence as her foothole, she began the near vertical climb up Cloud's leg to the seats; sadly her materia was short range, and she practically had to be touching the target before she could successfully cast her spell.

A grin crept across Aeris' face as she began to realise her own success; she was about to humiliate the man whom she both loved and loathed, and the woman who's soul life purpose seemed to result in taking Aeris' happiness. She completed the climb in good time, trying her best to both conserve energy and remain unseen, and proceeded to approach Tifa's massive toned thighs.

The dilemma then struck her as to how she would carry out the final and most vital step of her plan; shrinking the pair and escaping with ease. Her magical strength would permit her to cast only a single spell on one person without needing to recooperate. The first hit was vital, if she missed she would surely fail. Even if she hit, if she was caught then she would ultimately fail too. Her decision to shrink Tifa was easily justified; Tifa was more of a danger to her at normal size than Cloud was, and Cloud could easily be swayed if he caught her.

She recalculated every step of the plan in her head as she continued to creep towards Tifa's enormous body; shrink Tifa, immediately duck for cover back in Cloud's shoe, rest, grow, return, shrink Cloud. It all seemed so simple and flawless.

With a deep breath, Aeris pulled the materia from her pocket, held one palm against Tifa's bare skin, and waited for her one shot. Her eyes gazed upwards, paying particular mind to the couple's gaze. Her mind raced, and her eyes darted, quickly taking in her surroundings; she estimated her height at only a couple of inches high, judging by the visible material textures of the seating and relative distances, her eyes looked longingly at the now enormous Cloud, who seemed bewildered at Tifa's disappearance, yet his sight had not yet fallen upon her. Finally her eyes saw a figure in a pink dress running across the seating towards Cloud. In less time than it had taken her to shrink, Tifa pieced together the puzzle, and with her teeth gritted in anger, she charged at full pelt towards the unsuspecting flower girl.

Aeris' sight was still returning as she ran towards the sanctuary of Cloud's shoe. The plan went well, Tifa had shrunk, Cloud had not noticed yet, and the last she saw Tifa she was still stumbling blindly. Her overconfident smirk was quickly shatted when an unseen weight collided roughly with her back and rammed her into the ground hard. Sunlight flooded into a silent secluded hut in the tranquil Island of Besaid as the drapery forming a door was thrown aside and a figure entered the room, sitting down at a small table in the centre of the room, aside a scarcely furnished bed and chest of drawers. The figure was Lulu, a powerful and short tempered dark mage of Besaid village, so reknowned for her magical abilities that she was personal guardian to Summoner Yuna of Besaid.

The curtain-like door shut off light to the room once again, and a small candle set alight with the wave of a finger dimly lit the small dwelling. Sitting at the table, Lulu produced a small battered roll of parchment, which she layed across the table to all corners. Covering the page were hundreds of interconnected runes, a small circle encapsulating each one, and a modest degree were illuminated with a subtle purple glow. This grid of spheric symbols was the personal log of any warriors strength; it showed the level of skill they had produced in any given amount of time, and in what areas. As her hand wafted over the page, more purple spheres began to faintly glow as Lulu made record of her progress as a mage. As she did so, a small sphere in a far corner connected to no others made a vague appearance then just as quickly disappeared. Lulu's eyes snapped straight to the suspicious space, and her hand's attention returned to it again. This time, as clear as day, a small sphere with the rune symbol for white magic appeared. Lulu could not decifer the spells purpose or worth, but seeing no harm in doing so, she produced a small turquoise sphere, which she settled gently into the parchment. It sunk into the depths of the page, and the small ink circle of white magic flashed brightly then dimmed to conform to the other purple ones.

Lulu yearned to inspect the magic and its uses. Knowing it was white magic it could not harm anybody who wasn't one of the fallen or undead, she pondered where it should be tested.

"Lulu, may i speak with you a moment please?"

a voice broke her concentration, and a mumble reply summoned one of her companions into the hut. Lulu hurridly hid the sphere grid scroll, keeping one hand free in case to perform magic, and turned to welcome....

"What is it?" Lulu replied, in her typicaly husky tone, displaying indifference yet not hostility.

"erm... well" Tidus fumbled, he had never been very comfortable around Lulu, let alone having even a brief one to one conversation with her, "we're all gonna head off for a festival in Kilika, an' we thought we'd best ask and see if you wanted to come along."

13422.content:
Lulu pondered a moment before replying to Tidus.

"Perhaps not on this occasion little guardian."

Tidus nodded and turned to leave.

"Tidus."

Tidus turned and looked back at the ice cold expression on Lulu's face.

"It seems you have a wound on your upper arm."

Tidus marveled at her amazing perception in picking it so simply, as the cut was almost completely covered by his uniform.

"Oh this? yeah just a scratch, nothing to worry about." Tidus replied confidently.

"In anycase, allow me to heal it before you depart." Lulu replied, with no change in her tone or expression.

Tidus waited a moment; he had always liked to be friends with Lulu, never given the chance to know her properly before a barrier seemed to appear between them. If this could in someway improve their standing with each other, then Tidus was all for it.

"Er ok Lulu, thanks."

Lulu gave only a small smile then raised herself off her chair, her dark dress still cascading the floor around her feet. Raising her hand previously behind her back above her head, with a swishing motion across Tidus' upper body the spell was cast. Only the smallest of lights was produced from the spell, but in it's wake was left the body of a 2 inch tall guardian.

Tidus had allowed the warmth of the healing spell to engulf him, and his dwingling stature was unknown to him. He opened his eyes to a familiar dark view, but nothing seemed familiar anymore. Just as he had opened his mouth to thank Lulu, his vision gradually returned, bestowing him with the glorious sight of the beautiful black mage, seemingly hundreds of feet tall.

Lulu had been frightened a moment when the spell seemed to make Tidus disappear, but as her eyes fell on the dwingling light on the ground, which soon faded to show the tiny guardian's body, her eyes widened. The power this spell controlled seemed magnificent, and as her mind wafted with ambition and creative uses, her mind also found jealousy; this spell was to remain hers alone, and it seemed to have only a one way function. Tidus may well be stuck at his stature, and anybody finding him would certainly conclude magic did the deed. Unless she could find an anti-thesis to this shrinking spell, Tidus was not to meet eyes with another soul.

As her mind made up, Lulu's gaze lowered again to the tiny guardian, whos eyes had now met hers and showed a look of total horror.

"L... Lulu...?" Tidus stammered, unable to comprehend what had just happened.

"Well hello there tiny guardian. It seems you've served as a perfect test subject for this spell. In any case, i'm afraid these tests have to remain secret, so i guess you won't be attending that festival after all then."

Lulu broke into a smirk, unable to resist the urge of control she was feeling. Anticipating he would soon turn to run, Lulu's hand swooped down and grasped Tidus firmly around his waist. She raised him up to her eyes and studied him carefully.

"Remarkable", Lulu continued, "You do seem to be in a perfectly healthy state, regardless of the spell's effects."

Tidus was squirming fruitlessly in the giant mage's grip, but Lulu hardly noticed nor cared.

Lulu's trance was broken when she heard footsteps entering her hut again. Hurridly thinking Lulu forced the tidy guardian down the front of her dress and assumed her seat at the table again.

"Lulu?"

Lulu turned to see Yuna standing at the door.

"Hello Yuna, what is it you want?" Lulu replied, forming an impeccably straight face despite the struggling captive in her cleavage.

"I believe Tidus came by asking if you wished to join us for a festival." Yuna asked, no element of suspicion or accusation in her voice.

"Yes he did come past earlier, but he left quickly. Said he had urgent business in Luca i believe." Lulu calmed responded.

Yuna seemed mildly distressed at the news, "business? well what with? was he ok?"

"He seemed perfectly alright to me. I'm sure he will return in due time Yuna, do not worry yourself." Lulu consoled.

Yuna was not to be calmed so easily though, "I will go to Luca to find him, it's not like him to leave so quickly. Please come with us, we may need a lot of help."

Lulu was gritting her teeth, fighting off the wave of pleasure still emersing from the figure flailing in her dress. She felt warm yet somewhat irritable, and spending several days under the watchful eyes of other guardians whilst concealing a captive in her dress was not appealing to her.

"Yuna i'm afraid i must stay, business implores me so. Besides, you will make better time with fewer number."

The stalemate held for a second; Yuna could not get the thought of Tidus in danger from her mind, and longed to search for him, whereas Lulu had the summoner's love-interest squirming between her adequate breasts and was looking mainly for solitude. Soon enough though, the situation came to a close....

"But father..." Seung Mina said.
"End of discussion! Now return to your room." Han Myong said. Mina walked past her angry father and towards the front door.

Seung Mina sat on her bed in disgust. She was 23 years old, yet her father simply would not allow her to venture out and see the world like so many other brave young warriors have before her.
"It's so not fair... how come he still treats me like a child?" Mina asked to herself. She then got up and walked around the house with her Zanbatou, just trying to pass the time by.

But then she stopped when she looked by the medicine cabinet to see a weird bright green-colored potion sitting out in the open. Mina picked it up and looked at it.
"Hmmm... I wonder what this stuff does?" Mina asked herself. Curiousity soon got the best of her and she decided to pop the bottle open and drink the potion. She didn't necessarily prefer the potion's taste.

"Ick... tastes just like my headache medicine." Seung Mina said. She then started to walk back to her room, not realizing that she had just drunken a growth potion.

How big will Seung Mina grow?

A few k's from the nearest town she met a strage man dressed black. "I've been waiting for you Xianghua." he smoothly said. Xianghua placed her hand on her sword and unclasped it from the sheath. The man threw aside the cloak to reveal a barely human form reethed in flame, and from his chest he drew the legendary blade, Soul Edge.

The fight began, the fire beast charged and though Xianghua succesfully blocked, she wsa thrown backwards. "such power." she exclaimed. He charged once again but missed her, this was her chance, she thought. She dived towards the beast and drove her blade through its back. It dropped the sword and rose to the air, screaming and flailing until it exploded. Xianghua reacked for the sword but before she could touch it, it plunged into her chest. She screamed in agony, but looked at the wound to see no blood come out. the sword seemed to be shrinking inside her. Upon looking around she saw she had grown, i mean REALLY grown. She estimated her height to be around 300ft. After worrying for a second she thought maybe she could get used to this. (Ok, from here we have 2 options for the story. Let her catch one person for an "intimate" story. Or let her smash up a town or two.)

I have to be careful that I don't crush anything valuable or anyone. I will not let this demon blade's power corrupt me.' thinks Xianghua as the mighty giantess keeps walking..

In a nearby field Link of all people is relaxing next to a tree. 'Oh man this search for the infamous Soul Edge is going no where fast.' thought the young man before he sighed. "I wish I had some type of lead." hoped Link. Suddenly as if the gods had been listening in on the swordsman the ground begins to tremble and quake. "What the hell?" Link hops to his feet with his sheild and Master Sword in hand. Suddenly he is dwarfed by a massive shadow. He looks up to see none other Xianghua.

"Wah, Xianghua!!" yells out Link as he falls on his rear. "Who?" questions Xianghua before by chance she looks down and spots Link.

"Link?" she asked benting down to get a closer look. "Xian? Is that really you? What happened?" asked Link as he picked himself up from the ground. "Yup its all me. Surprised huh, well so am I." she tells him. "How did this happen and how big are you are?" "Well I'm about 300 ft. and I grew a bit after I absorbed Soul Edge into me." she stated. "Wait you absorbed the blade?" asked Link. "Well not by choice it just thursted into me and I couldn't stop it, soon afterwards I grew. Link please you have to help me." pleaded Xianghua.

"Okay claim down Xian, I'll help you the best I can. Don't worry together we'll get that blade out of you." said Link with a smile. "Thank you Link." said Xianghua as she lowered her hand so Link could climb on. Link did so and she lifted him to her right shoulder. "Xianghua I give you my word I'll find you a cure." said Link. Xianghua blushed at Link's comment. She had always found the swordsman handsome ever since she met him a few months ago and now he was willing to help cure her. "Thank you again Link. Well hang on tight cause here we go." said Xianghua as she began to walk off.

Link stole a glance at the giant Xianghua and he had to admit she was pretty and very attractive even more so now. 'Well now I know where the blade is, but how exactly do I get it out?..' wondered Link as Xianghua continued walking...

"Um Link...?" "Huh?...Yes Xianghua, what is it?" asked Link turning his head to look at her face. "Well we made it to a town. Its just ahead but I'm not sure how the villagers will react to me. I mean just look at me."

Link glanced her over and slightly smiled at her. "Xianghua listen to me you're beautiful just a bit big thats all. Besides you don't want to kill them right?" "What? No! Of course not." "Then you have nothing to fear, as along as they noticed that you bring no harm to their town I'm sure they won't give us a hard time. Even if they do I'll protect you, Xianghua."

Link then gave Xianghua a happy smile and the giantess blushed a bit before she nodded at him. "You're right Link, thank you." "Anytime Xian, anytime."

13512222.title: Last choice

135122221.content:
Sophitia and Haphaestus swung their bodies and weapons in every which way possible. Haphaestus was a monster compared to the small Sophitia, but she did not let his size intimidate her any. She just let her Omega Sword & Elk Shield do the talking. Neither had been able to take too many strikes, blows, or draw any blood for that matter.

Until an acrobatic counterattack by Sophitia did Haphaestus in. Haphaestus held his stomach and grimaced in pain. He wasn't hurt too bad, but it was a big hit compared to how the blows he had taken for the past 15 minutes in his battle with Sophitia.

After taking several more hits by Sophitia, he held his hand in front of the young warrior.
"Stop now, Sophitia. You have proven yourself worthy." Haphaestus said, smiling. Just then, a trio of gods appeared from behind Sophitia. At 200 feet tall each, they were certainly overwhelming in both power and size, but Sophitia knew how to deal with such a thing, since she was raised among these legends. Sophitia kneeled down before the gods.

"Sophitia. It is with great honor that all of us and the rest of the gods congratulate you on this momentus occasion. Never before has a human as valient as you been able to demonstrate your superiority over us gods even when not granted the full power." the gods said.
"Thank you, gods. I owe so much to all of you because you have helped guide me in all of my quests. I could never have destroyed the Soul Edge without your aid." Sophitia said.
"Yes, we were most fortunate that someone like you could defeat such an evil force before its evil could be spread across the world." the gods said.

"But now is not the time to reflect. Stand by as we send the rest of our power down to you..." the gods said. Just then, Sophitia looked down at herself to see her entire body glowing white. This lasted for a few seconds. Finally, it stopped glowing, and she looked back up at the gods.

"Sophitia, our newest goddess, in addition to all the power that we gods have possessed for several millennia, you have also been granted with the power to change the size of..."
135122221.title: The gift of the gods

1351222211.content:
"...magically alter the physical state of your body. No longer will we have to adjust our necks to get a clear view of each other." the gods said.

Sophitia could understand what they meant by this, and it came as a huge surprise to her. She knew one day she could at least have the chance to earn goddess-like powers, but she didn't think the gods would go as far as allow her to change her size at will. Could they be trusting her this much?

Nevertheless, Sophitia shook off this thought and looked back up at the gods.
"Thank you, gods. May I ask how I can take advantage of this size-changing power that you have bestowed upon me?" Sophitia asked.
"It's quite simple. Just close your eyes and imagine how small your people should be. Whether they be below your waistline or micro enough to fit onto your hand, that is up to you as you guide your thoughts and prayers." the gods said.

Sophitia nodded and closed her eyes. She imagined little people walking amongst her tiny feet, much like how she was only a speck compared to the gods. The gods watched as she mastered this spell and witnessed her growing. Fortunately for Sophitia, her clothes and weapons were growing with her.

When Sophitia thought for long enough, she opened her eyes and nearly gasped at what she was seeing. She was standing eye-to-eye with the gods. She also looked down to see that what was once a vast battlefield that was reserved just for her and Haphaestus was now being covered by her feet.

"I... I don't know what to say..." That was all Sophitia could say.
"No need to say anything, Sophitia. You have earned your powers as a goddess. Now it is up to you to use them responsibly and for the good of the people." the gods said.
"I promise to use this new power with great care and never for any selfish purposes." Sophitia said.
"Excellent, Sophitia. That is all we wish to address with you. If at any time you need further assistance, you know how to find us." the gods said. Just then, they (along with Haphaestus) vanished completely from sight, leaving a 200-foot-tall Sophitia all to herself.

Rather than shrink back to normal, Sophitia chose to remain at her GTS state. She began to think of what she could possibly do with her new powers. She could visit her friends and family back home and notify them of the good news. Or she could fulfill a long wish held by the gods and find more evil to exterminate in the lands beyond her own.

13521.title: Kasumi?

1352121.content:
You leave early from work anticipating the events when you arrive back at your apartment. You check your mail on the way in and its there! a large package addressed to you sent via Ebay! You rush to the top of the block of flats and to your apartment and slam the door behind you. You turn on your Xbox and rip open the package. inside with all the packing foam is a small black remote, with the trademark green cross on the back. When the Xbox has started you put DOA volleyball in the drive and enter the game. You pause the game when it has a good shot of your favourite character, Ayane. Attaching an adaptor that came with the remote to the Xbox, a little red light appeared to indicate it was connected. Then twidling with some dials on the remote, the onscreen character Ayane (still paused) began to change sizes! Using different dials her height either got bigger or smaller. You smile gleefully. you've always been a gts fanatic and thought that the DOA girls were kinda hot, so when you found a size changing remote on ebay, you had to go for it. there was only one thing the guy who sold it had said, "don't change the sizes without pausing the game first!", and that was all.

You muck around with this sizes of different characters for a while; making them 50ft tall, 200ft and once even 1000ft! Then after you feel a little boredom, you decide to try this size changer while the game is playing. You choose Ayane as a character, wearing her skimpy blue bikini, and select a size on the remote. The screen goes black immediately but then a subtle white glow arises. it gets more and more intense until you can only see white. you feel faint and pass out, collapsing on the couch. You come too only a few seconds later and see your apartment in tatters. the Xbox and TV are smashed beyond recognition and the only thing left is the couch you're laying on. A huge tremor breaks the silence and you look around to see the roof of the apartment missing. another tremor shakes the earth and you're afraid to look what is causing them. After two more tremors, they mysteriously stop, and you decide to look outside the apartment. you raise yourself from the chair, and standing there, hundreds of feet above is Ayane. She is exactly as you would have always imagined her, if she was real. Except instead of crappy pixels and polygons, she was here in flesh and blood. she is still looking around the city, appartently still confused about what happened. she takes another step towards your apartment, and you realise her footfalls caused the tremors earlier. She spots the tattered block of flats and advances towards it. You duck down again, still not sure if you should show yourself. You are amazed about the results of the remote, taking a guess, you would estimate Ayanes height to be exactly what you had entered before the accident...

(Inspired from a fanfics about Claire, credits goes to Dr.Ray Palmer on fanfictions.net)


Seven years have passed since the Raccoon City viral incident.
Many lives have changed since then. But now Claire Redfield's life is about to suffer another great twist… Again.
Claire started working with Terra-Save, an organization that helps victims of biohazard incidents and viral outbreaks around the world.
She's currently involved with Terra-Save's operations in India to assist the local population affected by bio-weapon testing.

It's a shinning summer morning when Claire Redfield arrives at Harvardville Airport after a long travel to Asia…

Claire :" Ah… I'm finally here!"

She enters the airport terminal carrying her bag and looking for someone: Rani, the little Indian girl that lost her parents at the latest viral incident and now was under custody of her aunt, with supervision of Terra-Save. Claire suddenly spots the kid and, waving to her, start heading in her direction.
Along the way, Chris's sister remembers the photos of biohazard outbreaks that she examined during her flight. The images were horrible, disturbing. Full of anger, Claire wanted to take some attitude against people that had the power to prevent such tragedies but preferred to do nothing. She would like to have the power to punish them… But she couldn't.

The airport was very calm that morning, with not so many people and noise.
But somewhere at the terminal, someone watches silently the young lady, having something evil planned for her…
If Claire had read the newspaper of that day, maybe she became more careful…
Recently, an old weapon prototype created by Umbrella before its downfall was stolen from a U.S. top-secret base. The project was known as "Gargantua", but little revealed about it. According to some non-official reports, the weapon was capable of expand the mass of objects or living beings… Therefore, creating giants!

Army Intelligence always thought that this was complete bullshit, believing that the creation of such weapon was impossible at least until the 23rd century, and Umbrella was involved with bio-weaponry, not this kind of technology…
Anyway, now it was missing.
As Claire walks towards the terminal, she somehow has a bad feeling about what is about to happen… She gets close to Rani, hugs her and says "hi" to her aunt. They talk very gently, Redfield mentioning her "boyfriend", a report she has to turn in soon… But the annoying feeling won't go away.

Claire sits down, trying to relax, but the naïve child notices something strange, pointing at the terminal's second floor.

Rani : Look, Claire! That man has a funny gun!
Claire, confused: What?
Redfield looks at the direction indicated by the Indian girl, spotting a mysterious man covered by a trench coat and a large hat. He took something out of his clothes… A weird gun similar to a laser pistol from sci-fi stories like "Star Wars". It is made of shinning metal and looks pretty inoffensive… But that's not the truth.
The unknown man suddenly points the gun to Claire.

Claire : No, don't shoot me!
And the enemy attacks…
135222122221.title: At the airport

1352221222211.content:
(Inspired from a fanfics about Claire, credits goes to Dr.Ray Palmer on fanfictions.net)

Claire tries to escape the shot, but it's pointless. The enemy fires and an intense beam of light hits the young woman right on her chest. Rani and all the people around her, scared, run away immediately. A bright explosion happens around Claire's body, and right after it she notices her skin is extremely hot. Feeling dizzy, she looks very fast at the upper floor: the marksman isn't there anymore.

And, for her desperation, Claire suddenly grows.

She at first thought the terminal and its objects where getting somehow smaller, but in fact it was Redfield who was going bigger and bigger. After a few seconds she could already touch the ceiling with her arms without even have to raise them.

CLAIRE: No! What's happening to me? Please, someone help me!

The transformation ended suddenly, with Claire's head a few inches from crashing trough the ceiling. She could barely move, the now tinny terminal's structure looking like a cage. The girl was trapped inside a doll house, and it would be difficult to get out without torn it apart.

As Claire made sure the process really stopped, she tried to figure out what really happened.

CLAIRE: Oh my God! Why the people are so tiny!?

In fact, now everyone in the airport grounds, compared to Claire, was at the size of an action-figure, maybe even smaller. And panic conquered the entire terminal as the new figure of Redfield was seen. People were frightened, without understand what happened and not interested in it. They just did not want to be crushed.

Man running: Run, run! It's a giantess, a monster!

CLAIRE: No, come back! You've got to help me!

The terminal was soon empty, even the security guards leaving the place scared as hell. Claire was left behind alone, confused and big. She was feeling horrible. How she could revert that situation? She didn't want to stay like that forever! The man with the ray gun had to be found and then…

CLAIRE: Calm down, Claire, calm down… First I have to get out of here.

And she also had to thank God that her clothes had grown with her body… If being a giantess was tough, being a naked one was certainly tougher.

It's was really hard to perform any move inside the terminal, and Claire had to crouch because her head was hitting the ceiling with her forehead every time she tried to get her face up. Crawling like a baby and thinking she could swear being inside the book "Alice in Wonderland", Redfield found, after some minutes of search, an exit bigger enough to comport her body. She lowered her chest even closer to the ground, getting prone, and managed to move out of the terminal's interior…

She broke some adjacent glasses in the process, but… Bingo! Claire was out.

Getting up and realizing that the whole airport complex was now like a very detailed miniature set at her feet, Claire saw herself at the front entrance, with the taxis and other cars on the street similar to the toy vehicles Chris never allowed her to play with during their childhood. The difference was that they were real cars. And Claire a very large lady.

CLAIRE: Oh, ah… OK, I'm out!

What to do next?
1352221222211.title: Claire is growing !

13522212222111.content:
Claire looked around her. The entire Harvardville Airport complex was now like a miniature-sized model. People were the size of little "army men" figures, running scared as they saw the giant lady standing on her feet right outside the main terminal. The girl was really confused. She never imagined herself on a situation like that. For a moment, she tough she was dreaming…

It was when Claire remembered a film she had watched lately. Actually, it was exhibited aboard the plane she just had traveled. "Alice in Wonderland". In the movie, the protagonist also shrank and grew many times, and, thinking she as dreaming, pinched herself to get awake.

Claire thought the idea as a bit silly and naïve but, using one of her arms, pinched the other one lightly. The pain was almost none, and even if it was more intense, Claire had survived the Raccoon City incident: she could sustain a lot of pain…

…

The situation hasn't changed. Claire was still there, standing tall with a tiny airport and tiny humans at her feet. Surreal enough. And she was not dreaming at all.

Well, at this new size, I'll really be able to sustain MUCH pain – she thought, thinking that as least that bizarre situation had a bright side.

Claire looked down. Her right foot was almost crushing a Sedan car, its alarm turned on. She moved her shoe away, surprised, and said ashamed:

CLAIRE: Sorry…

The area around the airport was now seemly abandoned. More calm, the young woman started to think again about her curious and unbelievable situation. What she could do? What could turn her back to normal? Yes, the mysterious marksman! She had to find him and get his strange ray gun! Maybe it had a reversal option, shrinking her back to her normal size!

That seemed the only viable option at that moment. As a giantess, Claire could move easily and faster around, traveling great distances, but it was not going to be simple to find a man the size of a toy. Play hide-and-seek with him was almost the same as playing with an insect. He could be simply ANYHERE, hiding inside ANY BUILDING. And, with all the things so tiny, searching for him without making any destruction would be difficult.

And what was the best place to search at first?

Things were more and more confusing…

CLAIRE: Being huge like this is a whole new experience for me… Let's see what I can do now…

Redfield looked around again, and observed the landing strip, with some airplanes taxiing. Some where flying away, the pilots probably in a hurry to escape the scaring giant woman, and others arriving at the terminal, the poor people inside them afraid the unexplainable figure could walk to their direction and harm them somehow.

Then, a sudden thought emerged in Claire's mind: and if the marksman was trying to escape the scene inside one of those jets? It was possible. Really possible. Almost probable.

It deserved a look. With extreme caution, not wanting to crush or destroy anyone or anything while moving, Claire stretched one of her legs over the main terminal building. As her foot hit the ground at the other side, luckily with nobody hurt, earth shake. Claire smiled: the situation was funny, anyway. With more confidence, she moved her other leg, standing above the building like the Colossus of Rhodes… And managed to land her other foot on the other side too. No damage, no deaths. Everything OK until that moment.

She looked down. Small airplanes at her feet, each one about the size of a model airplane. When she was younger, before the Raccoon incident, Chris used to take her to expos around the country where, with rock bands playing and motorcycle addicts getting together, enthusiasts of aeromodelling also appeared sometimes. There where many planes on the landing strip. Verify each one of them would take a lot of time, and she could damage them by accident. And, unfortunately, Claire wouldn't be able to repair them with glue and a bit of patience…

You are walking along on the way home when a noise behind you startles you out of your previous train of thought.
Turning around, you see a giantess. From your perspective, she could be anywhere from twenty to fifty feet - still tall enough to have to bend over considerably to pick you up!
"Well," says the giantess. "Looks like I have a new toy.
"T-t-toy?!" you say, sweat beading on your forehead from the heat of her hand.
"Yes, toy," says the giantess, almost snapping. "My old toy... well, he disobeyed me. I had to punish him."
You gulp, at a loss for words.
-A short while later-
The giantess eventually came to a large cavern. Once inside, she set you down and placed a giant boulder at the entrance. Despite your fear, you marvel at her rippling muscles as she does this. She has a bit of meat on her, but still enough muscle to turn you on.
"There," said the giantess, straightening. "No escaping for you."
The giantess crosses over to a straw-covered part of the cavern and strips off her clothes, which are very skimpy - given the amount of animal hides it must have taken to make what little there was, you're not surprised.
"Time to see if you're up to par," says the giantess, spreading her legs. "Pleasure me."
"How?" you ask, afraid of being crushed.
"Surprise me," says the giantess, closing her eyes and waiting.
